Lesson 5: Advanced Spatial Point Patterns Analysis

In this lesson, you will learn the basic concepts of Local Colocation Quotients CLQs (in short Local CLQ)
Published

December 31, 2022

Modified

February 5, 2023

Content

  • Local Co-Location Quotient
    • Basic oncept of co-location
    • Applications of Co-location Quotient
    • The formula

Lesson Slides and Hands-on Notes

  • Lesson slides in html and pdf formats

  • Handout of In-class Exercise 5: Local Co-Location Quotient in html and pdf formats.

References

  • Timothy F. Leslie, & Barry J. Kronenfeld (2011). “The Colocation Quotient: A New Measure of Spatial Association Between Categorical Subsets of Points.” Geographical Analysis, Vol. 43 (3), 306-326. doi: 10.1111/j.1538-4632.2011.00821.x

  • Cromley, R.B., Hanink, D.M. & Bently, G.C. (2014) “Geographically Weighted Colocation Quotients: Specification and Application”, Professional Geographer, Vol 66, No. 1. pp. 138-148. SMU e-library.

  • Yue, H. et. al (2017) “The Local Colocation Patterns of Crime and Land-Use Features in Wuhan, China”, International Journal of Geo-Information.

  • Fahui Wang, Yujie Hu, Shuai Wang & Xiaojuan Li (2017). “Local Indicator of Colocation Quotient with a Statistical Significance Test: Examining Spatial Association of Crime and Facilities.” The Professional Geographer Vol. 69 (1), 22-31. doi: 10.1080/00330124.2016.1157498. SMU e-Library.
